name: The Menzies Sydney

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights over Christmas. The hotel is old and a bit tired in places (e.g. peeling wallpaper in the bedrooms) however the rooms and clean and tidy. The included buffet breakfast was fairly good. The location is excellent for a short stay in Sydney, across the road from Wynyard Station, just 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay and 20 minutes walk to Darling Harbour.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: lovely hotel, nice central location. friendly helpful staff, nice swimming pool and gym .the bar seems to close very early however plenty of other places to get a drink nearby .all in all a great old world hotel
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: We have stayed at The Menzies many times over the last few years with both Kids and without the Kids. I have always found the staff polite, friendly and helpful. The rooms are always clean and tidy. What also makes this place perfect is that you step out the front and its Wynard Train station, or go through the back and its Buses. So perfect for hopping trains and buses around the city with Kids, or walking distance to other main attractions. Family Rooms have Two Double Beds and Kids Eat Free.Highly recommended :)
reviews.title: Fabuous Family Hotel

reviews.text: Not a bad hotel - it's old and heritage listed, so I don't think they can't do much with the structure in terms of renovations. Staff were friendly and efficient, although the wait in line to check in was about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Old, but comfortable and ok for a night. Location is excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed was comfortable enough and room was fine for a night's stay.
reviews.title: old icon gets a facelift

reviews.text: TV in the room really small to see from the bed.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced, Value for Family

reviews.text: The two biggest issues were that the water pressure in the shower was lacking and that the air con in the room virtually had no effect on the temperature.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: Rooms at the Menzies were surprisingly quiet since it is next to a major transit station. We also had a very large room which was impeccably cleaned. Access to the sites we wanted to see was either walkable or easy using the tube or buses to get to the ferries. Not too many restaurants nearby which was only an issue on our one rainy day. Overall, a very good choice for Sydney.
reviews.title: Easy access to Sydney's high points

reviews.text: Menzies is centrally located opposite the Wynyard station and is walking distance to the Rocks. Sydney Opera House and the Harbour werent too far away either. Eating places are aplenty and hotel in itself is quite comfortable with good service levels
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.text: Close the everywhere I wanted to go in the City of Christmas Shopping. Beds are a little bit too soft. Meal in restaurant was awesome. Service was outstanding. Car park was a tad expensive but I guess you expect this in the CDB. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Happy to Stay Again
Best Value Hotel in Sydney
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located near Wynard station, easy access to rail and airport. Services was faultless, breakfast buffet very good, room service excellent. This hotel oozes warmth and style. It has aged gracefully over the years and its great to see that this hotel has blended tradition with modern conveniences. I am a fan of this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first stay at The Menzies. Great location, easy walking to all attractions and as a bonus, train and buses only metres away. Very clean and well presented rooms. Large lounge and bar area . Expensive breakfast but pleanty of close by good value venues . On the down side, check out very slow,(understoof this to be the normal..so allow extra 10 /15 minutes). Cant imagine why we have overlloked the Menzies for so long... we will be back.!
reviews.title: A great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room and service were great. Food and drinks were fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a first class hotel which provides old world charm with first class service. The location is just perfect for a stay in the city with everything close handy.
reviews.title: Old World Charm and service
Great place to stay - close to everything in Sydney.
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and helpful, room was very clean and comfortable - couldn't ask for a better place to stay in Sydney.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a little dated but in quite a good location and a short walk to Shops.
reviews.title: A little dated
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location - walking distance to the city centre and Darling Harbour, across the road from the railway station. Staff were friendly and helpful, room was pleasant - overall a great stay.

reviews.title: most disapointing
reviews.text: Rooms very small and pokey, bathroom disgusting. Sound of lifts going up and down al night very annoying. Quality of hotel has degenerated since my last stay a few years ago.

reviews.title: Our stay
reviews.text: We were bitterly disappointed with this Accor hotel. We are used to very good value for money, but the amount was far greater than the service. The room was tired and bed hard as. The window was not clean and unable to see out of clearly. We were not made to feel welcome and there was not a good ambience. Sorry but we are normally very happy...

Our family of 4 stayed in a Standard Room for 4 nights with breakfast included. The breakfast was good, lots of food and choices. Although our room was a bit old, we did get what we paid for, a standard room with 2 double beds. The room was clean and comfortable. The Desk staff were very nice, friendly and helpful. The Conceirge were always pleasant and helpful. The indoor heated pool was too cold and the spa was too hot!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location for a good price

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the Location, we either walked everywhere or caught the free bus (333, behing the hotel on George St) and then walked to where we wanted to go.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel is in front of the metro station, 20 mins to the airport.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: room was big, wi-fi is limit to half an hour and data of 8MB, breakfast was a bit too busy.
reviews.title: IN MAJOR NEED OF A REFURB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an excellent location within a short walk from the station from the airport and close to all parts of the CBD. That's where the good points start to fail me.
reviews.title: Time for an Overhaul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check-in it took an age for the reception staff to find my reservation which I had made by telephone a couple of weeks earlier. I suspect that it may not be unconnected to the fact that my room card subsequently had my name spelt incorrectly.....
reviews.title: Don't miss the Piano Bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, on arrival in the room, the decor is truly dated and looks at least 30 years old. Not that the size of the room is bad but that combined with the noisy clunky a/c and an inability to be able to open an exterior window really did leave us disappointed.
reviews.title: Great service and location!

description: The Menzies Sydney is a 4 star hotel located on Wynyard Park in the heart of Sydney. With 446 beautifully appointed rooms, this is the ideal choice for business trips, holidays and exciting city breaks. With extensive conference facilities catering for up to 450 delegates, the hotel also boasts three bars, two restaurants and a swimming pool. City attractions such as the historic Rocks precinct, Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House are on your doorstep, with immediate access to public transport.
